ReviewList.Text: For those who studied physics long time ago, this book is very good to remind and recall what is Physics.

This is the second of two Dummies books on physics. It is practical and useful on explaining the basics but not so elementary that it looses importance. You might have better books explaining the maths, but the simple but well written text is not mired with loads of mathematical proofs, but does have a nice mix.
The first book got me an A in my college physics class. This book looks as thought it will get me another! I go to Florida State University....not exactly an easy school, so this does it's job!

While the concepts are explained a lot better, they go no where near as in depth as most textbooks, and really only touch the surface of a lot of things. Don't expect this thing to replace your textbook anytime soon.

Since our school thought it was a good idea to use Thomas A. Moore's Six Ideas That Shaped Physics, I have had no idea what is going on. This book definitely fills in the blanks and compensates for our Physic's teaching (or lack thereof).

I am taking graduate level physics classes and I carry this book to class with me. When introduced to a new topic in class, I read this first and then proceed to build on it. It does a great job in building the foundation and putting complicated terms into everyday situations. The math is not complicated, simple trigonometry and algebra. Easy read. Perfect for beginners.

This book follows the usual "Dummies" format of the KISS principle: Keep It Simple Stupid.  Easy reading with easy understanding.  It is helpful to have the Physics I, first -- not a necessity, but very helpful.

This is a good book and a solid introduction. No complaints on content.  I have two engineering degrees from 30 yrs ago, and my son is now taking this stuff, hence my renewed interest so I have help him with homework.  I gave the book 3 stars because I got the Kindle editio.  The only issue is that the formulas are microscopic in size  in the Kindle version.  A major defect in my opinoin.  You can't see them without tapping on them to open a window to enlarge them, and even then, sometimes they are still too small to read. Further, the tapping or double tap to open them frequently failed and merely advanced the pages in the book- mind numbingly frustratiing.  The content is good- buy the paper version.
Always useful. I have used these books and now they have been very useful for my daughter in college. Great!

This book was totally worth every penny spent. My professor was horrible this semester, and the textbook just made things even more confusing. This is a great way to have concepts literally dumbed down for you a bit, so that you can understand them. I wish I only bought this and not my actual textbook for the class! This helped me a lot, and without it, I don't know where my grade would be right now!
It was a fun read. I refer to it from time to time to read about and understand the world around us

Fast delivery, and the book has been so helpful so far. Using it in combination with the main study guide to prepare for a nursing entrance exam. Dreaded physics in college, but after using this book, I wish I discovered it earlier! Thank you!
In some areas it was helpful, in some aspects-esp. the really in-depth stuff-not so much. If you have a teacher who just likes to put equation up with no explanation-save your money and hire a tutor!
Exactly what my son needed.  The Amazon pricing could not be beat and the shipping was FAST.  It provided the insight and details the teacher was not "TEACHING" the kids.
This book breaks down all anyone needs to know about the lessons and textbook. It comes in handy when the professor refuses to help the student beyond the lessons in classes
I was trying to teach myself Physics 2 and this was a great supplement to my textbook. I would recommend this book to anyone needing a little extra physics help.
Product was exactly as advertised and provided me exactly what I was expecting.  Cannot ask for anything more than that with this type of transaction.
This book offers a great variety of concepts and explains them in a way that makes sense. The equations, charts, tables, and pictures really helped.
This text is a five-star book due to the excellent examples, graphics, and definitions.  I hope that this text will be published for many years.
like it so far very informative and explains concepts properly. It's good as a study aid but don't rely on it over a textbook.

I teach Physics and our school does not have a physics text book since we do most of the course work on line. I needed a simple way to fill in the gaps for what we were getting on line and what we were doing in the classroom. The Physics for Dummies series was a great resource. The exercises were practical and easy for the students to understand. I really like the relationship between the books and the workbook. This has been really useful for my students.
These books are really helpful for college level students who may need to get up to speed on some of the subjects.

Dissatisified! The explanations are all very straightforward and I am happy about that. Problem is that the material I am studying for university physics 2 is only covered in this book in very minute detail.
Bought for my son. He said it was helpful.
Great review  when time is short.
It is pretty helpful.
Best I ever saw.
very good  thx
Excellent
excellent
thank you
good book
good
